$values.Title: C# and OOP
$values.Description: Questions about the C# language and object-oriented programming.

$values.QuestionText: Which modifier would you apply to a type's member to allow only code within that type access to it?
Which keyword would you apply to a type's field to prevent its value from changing after an instance of the type has been created?
Which keyword would you apply to a method in a base class to allow it be polymorphically re-defined?
Which keyword would you apply to a method in a derived class to allow it be non-polymorphically re-defined?

$values.Title: File I/O
$values.Description: Questions about the file input/output features of the .NET Framework including serialization.

$values.QuestionText: What are the requirements for a type to be serialized by using the BinaryFormatter?
$values.AnswerB: Apply [Serializable] to the type and make all fields public.
$values.AnswerC: Ensure the type is public with a parameterless contructor.
$values.AnswerD: Ensure the type is public with a parameterless contructor and make any fields you want to include public.

$values.QuestionText: What are the requirements for a type to be serialized by using the XmlSerializer?
$values.AnswerB: Apply [Serializable] to the type and make all fields public.
$values.AnswerC: Ensure the type is public with a parameterless contructor.
$values.AnswerD: Ensure the type is public with a parameterless contructor and make any fields you want to include public.

$values.Title: ASP.NET Web Applications and Services
$values.Description: Questions about building MVC web applications and Web API services by using ASP.NET.

$values.QuestionText: Which of the following is NOT a requirement for an MVC controller?
$values.AnswerA: The class must implement the IController interface.
$values.AnswerB: The class must inherit from the Controller class.
$values.AnswerD: The class's action methods must NOT use generic types.
